definition: in a little while/in a moment/later on

sentences.english: Later, those boats were heavily outrun by modern ships.
sentences.chinese: 稍后，那些船很重地根据现代船跑得更快。

sentences.english: He later said he had a liver transplant during this period.
sentences.chinese: 他稍后表示在病休期间接受了一次肝移植手术。

sentences.english: It is a competing format to Dolby Digital which was released about a year after.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个稍后一年发布具有竞争力的杜比数字格式。

sentences.english: Later the Italian madrigal becomes the most distinguished genre.
sentences.chinese: 稍后，意大利牧歌成为最著名的作品。

sentences.english: Sorry, the number you dail is busy now. Please dail it again later.
sentences.chinese: 您好，您所拨打的电话正忙，请稍后再拨。

sentences.english: We will discuss the remaining fields later.
sentences.chinese: 我们将在稍后讨论剩余的区域。

sentences.english: Soon after, she began singing the national anthem regularly for Philadelphia's professional sports teams.
sentences.chinese: 稍后，她就开始经常为费城专业运动队演唱国歌。

sentences.english: I will expand on this in a minute.
ADD salt and tomato paste halfway through the cooking, or later.
sentences.chinese: 在烹饪过程加适量的盐或番茄酱或者稍后加。

sentences.english: Sorry. I'm in the middle of something. Would you mind calling back later?.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉。我正在忙一件事。你介意稍后再打来吗？

sentences.english: I can always add other finders by other properties later.
sentences.chinese: 稍后，总是可以通过其他属性添加其他查找程序。

sentences.english: This define keyword is something we'll see later on.
sentences.chinese: 这个define关键词，我们稍后会讲到。

sentences.english: B:On your call to Taiwan,the line is busy now.Will you place your call again later?
sentences.chinese: 您申请的台湾电话对方正在占线，稍后再挂过来好吗？

sentences.english: I will have an in depth article on this topic soon.
sentences.chinese: 就这个话题，我稍后会撰文作深入阐释。

sentences.english: You see an example of this later.
sentences.chinese: 稍后您可以看到一个示例。

sentences.english: Later I'll show you how to create a separate renderer.
sentences.chinese: 稍后我会介绍如何创建独立的渲染器。

definition: in a moment/later/also pr. [dai1 hui3 r5] or [dai1 hui5 r5]
variant of 少安毋躁[shao3 an1 wu2 zao4]
to be abbreviated to/(followed by a verb) slightly
to stop at this point/to end here/to call it a day
when the moment comes/at that time
